newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Indo Rama says plant work normal.
newsitem.headline: India's Indo Rama says plant work normal.

text.p: Indo Rama Synthetics (India) Ltd, one of India's biggest polyester makers, said on Saturday its plant in the western state of Maharashtra was fully operational despite labour problems.

"The company's stock position is comfortable," the firm said in a statement. "Committed staff and workers are ensuring that the Integrated Polyester Complex remains fully operational with normal despatches."
The company said some of the staff at its integrated polyester complex at Butibori in India's most industrialised state of Maharashtra had been absent since December 8 to press their demands.

The plant, which has an installed capacity of 156,700 tonnes per annum (tpa), manufactures polyster staple fibre (PSF), chips, polyester oriented yarn (POY), DTY and blended spun yarn, company officials said.
